qas.question: Which financial institution was the first one visible to run into trouble in the United States?
Who was Southern California-based IndyMac a spin-off of?
Before its failure, which savings and loan association was the seventh largest mortgage originator in the United States?
On what date did IndyMac fail?

context: The first visible institution to run into trouble in the United States was the Southern California–based <a0_0>IndyMac<a0_0/>, a spin-off of <a1_0>Countrywide Financial<a1_0/>. Before its failure, <a2_0>IndyMac Bank<a2_0/> was the largest savings and loan association in the Los Angeles market and the seventh largest mortgage originator in the United States. The failure of IndyMac Bank on <a3_0>July 11, 2008<a3_0/>, was the fourth largest bank failure in United States history up until the crisis precipitated even larger failures, and the second largest failure of a regulated thrift. IndyMac Bank's parent corporation was <a4_0>IndyMac Bancorp<a4_0/> until the FDIC seized IndyMac Bank. IndyMac Bancorp filed for Chapter 7 bankruptcy in July 2008.
